name: Why Are Scam of the Week or Security Hints and Tips Emails Being Flagged?
title: Why Are Scam of the Week or Security Hints and Tips Emails Being Flagged?
body:
If your Scam of the Week and Security Hints and Tips emails are being flagged or blocked in your mail client or anti-spam service can be caused by the open tracking image placed in each email. The open tracking image is used to track when the email has been opened.

You can turn this open tracking feature off by disabling it in your Account Settings. This will also prevent email opens from being tracked as part of your phishing tests. However, vulnerable behavior from your employees, such as clicking links or opening attachments, will still be tracked.

How to Turn Off Open Tracking

  1. From your KnowBe4 console, click your email address in the top right corner and select Account Settings.
  2. Navigate to the Phishing Settings section.
  3. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Save Changes to save your setting.

images.alt:
This technical description details a web user interface (UI) configuration panel titled **Phishing Settings**.

The panel is structured into two primary sections:

**1. Landing Configuration (Dropdowns):**
*   **Default Landing Page:** A dropdown selection field currently displaying the value **"404 Error Page."**
*   **Default Landing Domain:** A dropdown selection field containing a **redacted** domain value.

**2. Tracking and Reporting Options (Checkboxes):**
Three configuration options are listed as unchecked checkboxes, each accompanied by a standard help icon (circular question mark).

*   **Disable Email Open Tracking:** This option is the focus of the image, emphasized by a thick **orange rectangular border**. It is currently **unchecked**.
*   **Include Archived Users in Reports:** This option is **unchecked**.
*   **Overwrite [[domain]] Placeholder:** This option is **unchecked**.

All primary input labels (Landing Page, Landing Domain, and the three checkbox options) are followed by a help icon (?).

Navigate to the Phishing Settings section.
